result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Tubens

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Tubens appeared by video.  Attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas appeared by video for Joseph Tubens.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense reports that the defendant completed the TAD evaluation and requests a DPA hearing date. Case adjourned to Branch 1.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Joseph Tubens appeared by video.  Attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas appeared by video for Joseph Tubens.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Defendant needs to get a TAD evaluation and Atty. Vargas requests a status date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 089606,
Payable Number: 1033324,
Receipt Number: 22RP037738,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
No driving without a valid license. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joseph Tubens in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 1.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/29/22 @ 1:30p
